meanings.definition: A unit of dry measure equal to one tenth of an ephah.
meanings.sent1: The farmer measured the grains using an omers.
meanings.sent2: She bought two omers of wheat from the market.
meanings.sent3: The chef mistakenly used an omers instead of a cup in the recipe.
meanings.sent4: The omers of spices in the dish made it exceptionally flavorful.
meanings.sent5: The ancient omers were used to ensure fair trade in the marketplace.

meanings.sent4: The omers of flour were carefully measured for the bread.
meanings.sent5: The omers were used in ancient times to measure food portions precisely.

meanings.definition: A person who is in the habit of making or giving promises.
meanings.sent1: He was known as an omers because he always kept his word.
meanings.sent2: The politician was considered an omers due to his commitment to his promises.
meanings.sent3: The omers assured everyone that the project would be completed on time.
meanings.sent4: She was like an omers, always making pledges she couldn't keep.
meanings.sent5: The omers promised to bring positive change to the community.
